ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Exposed to a wide array of texts
How to write better
I learned how to write in a way that engages the reader and truly represents my voice through detailed narrating and powerful phrasing.

I learned how to write creative non-fiction.  It was definitely an interesting shift after having written only academic essays throughout high school.  This is the writing that is mostly found in essay collections and those really good New York Times articles.  I think the most important skills I learned in this class were;
*How to make my writing less stiff 
*How to make my writing more emotional
*Story Structure

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course were the interactive discussions and direct feedback from the instructor on our work and how it could be improved. I truly found no weaknesses.

Strengths;
*Lots of practice with writing
*Great, personalized feedback from the professor
*Lots of help with the planning/outlining phase
*Great advice from someone who worked in the journalism industry

Weaknesses;
*Lots of practice writing (Lol, its A LOT of essays, but theyre pretty fun so it evens out)
*Lots of reading (because great writers also have to be great readers)
The essays we read were terrific; I wish we spent a bit more focus dissecting the writing style of the author. We spent lots of time discussing content.

Strengths
Great readings, good class discussions (even though there were many days when we didn't get to all the readings)

Weaknesses
Little guidance on how to genuinely improve your writing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely, it definitely challenges you and is such a valuable experience.
I believe this class would be an integral class for anyone who aspires to be a writer or write well.

YES!!! A VERY EMPHATIC YES!!! This course gave me a lot of much-needed practice in writing in a way that was actually fun and interesting to read.  It also helped me remember that, despite its ups and downs, writing really is a fun process of self-discovery and unbridled creativity.
Yes! A great way to be held to a schedule of productivity.
Yes! English 120 is a great class and everyone should take it. If you're seriously concerned about keeping a high GPA (for whatever reason), then consider taking it Credit/D.
